page.title: 16SIBSON AERODROME:NORTH/ELTON
page.content:
Built in 1940 as a Satellite Airfield for Westwood Aerodrome in Peterborough it was in use until 1945. The mess and living quarters nearby became a displaced persons camp after the war and in 1956 was used for Hungarian refugees. They are now a chicken farm. The 200 acre aerodrome consists of two runways, one 700 metres and one 500 metres in a T-formation, a control tower,two hangers, bar and restaurant, offices, outbuildings and parking for tenants and users.
